short_summary: Emptying pits and disposing of sludge

full_summary:
================================About the Tender Announcement================================

Tender Notice Reference: 5P300-23-0304/A
Location: Forillon National Park

**Contract Duration and Delivery Dates**

The proposed contract duration is two (2) years, with an optional one (1) year extension. The contract period will start on May 15, 2024, and end on May 14, 2026. The contractor grants to Canada the irrevocable option to extend the term of the contract by up to one (1) additional year.

**Tender Requirements**

Parks Canada, Gaspésie Field Unit, requires the emptying and siphoning of multiple septic tanks and dry toilets, including the transport and disposal of sludge outside the boundaries of Forillon National Park.

**Evaluation Method**

Bids will be evaluated based on the lowest price.

**Tender Closing Date**

The tender closing date and time is April 5, 2024, at 14:00 (2:00 PM).

**Submission of Bids**

Bidders must submit their bids via email or fax, using the addresses listed below:

Email: soumissionsest-bidseast@pc.gc.ca
Fax: 1-877-558-2349

**File Size Limitation**

Please note that the maximum email file size that Parks Canada is capable of receiving is 15 megabytes.

**Language of Documents**

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

**Important Notes**

* Bids submitted in person or by courier will not be accepted.
* Emails with links to bid documents will not be accepted. Bid documents must be sent as email attachments.
* Bidders must obtain the solicitation documents from the Government Electronic Tendering Service, available at http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities.

**Enquiries and Contact Information**

For technical and contractual enquiries, please contact the Contracting Authority. All enquiries must be submitted in writing and received no later than five (5) calendar days prior to the tender closing date.

Contact Information:
Eric Robinson
eric.robinson@pc.gc.ca
(873) 355-0824
